text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with grilled hearts of romaine
salad that's right we're grilling
lettuce can you believe it anyway this
was filmed down in Monterey on location
on a farm tour we did which you have to
read about on the blog so follow the
link to the post and check that out but
anyway I wanted to show you the
technique because it's so easy all you
need to do is get some grill pans really
hot smoking hot super hot this works
great outside for obvious reasons but
you can also do this on your stove on
grill pans you're going to cut hearts of
romaine in half you're going to brush it
with olive oil and you're going to lay
them down cut side down for two minutes
and it's just gonna lightly caramelize
the surface get a little bit of a smoky
flavor into the lettuce but the inside
is still going to stay cool and crisp so
I guess technically this is a warm salad
but it's really not going to be a soft
wilted salad all right you can see there
when they come off the grill there's
that nice caramelization
but again the inside still crisp still
fresh all right still very lettuce like
now as soon as you take them off while
the surface is still hot you want to hit
them with some cheese pecorino would be
great Reggiano parmesan perfect of
course then you want to do some vinegars
then finish with olive oil
I believe this chef put on two different
vinegars looks like sherry and balsamic
but I could be wrong and then olive oil
alright be generous my only complaint
here a little stingy on the oil and
vinegar I think you want to douse them
pretty good anyway there you go
grilled hearts of romaine salad next
time you want a little change of pace
from that usual old Caesar salad give
this a try and like I said check out
food wishes comm for more information
and as always enjoy
you
